subject: Technology
title: WAP: The Internet's First Try on Phones
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on WAP: The Internet's First Try on Phones.

hook.text: Before smartphones, phones could technically access the internet. The experience was awful.

buildup.text: WAP pages loaded slowly on tiny screens. A single page could take 30 seconds over 2G.

discovery.text: Carriers charged by the kilobyte, making even basic browsing painfully expensive.

twist.text: Despite the pain, millions tried WAP. People clearly wanted the web in their pocket.

climax.text: WAP proved the demand for mobile internet existed. The technology just wasn't ready yet.

punchline.text: The mobile web started ugly. The desire was always there.

quiz.question: What was the main problem with WAP mobile internet?
options: It was too fast for phones to handle
It was slow, expensive, and hard to use
It only worked on one phone brand
